other_tests.findings: Mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy with normal cavity size and normal regional-global systolic function (ejection fraction, >60%); peak gradient across the aortic valve was 97 mm Hg; aortic valve area of 0.7 cm2; mild mitral regurgitation observed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Peak gradient increased from 67 mm Hg (2008) to 97 mm Hg (2009), indicating progression of aortic stenosis.

other_tests.findings: Stopped after 6.75 minutes due to fatigue and an asymptomatic reduction in blood pressure; ECG showed ST segment depression (2 to 2.5 mm upsloping-horizontal, downsloping in recovery); interpreted as probably normal myocardial perfusion.
Showed ST segment depression that changed from upsloping-horizontal to downsloping during recovery.
Demonstrated 90% stenoses of the first and second obtuse marginal arteries.
